Reviews.Title: “Excellent chice in Mexico City”
Reviews.Author: Ziamom
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located next to Revolución. Very safe and tranquil area! From metro, just 5mins walking. Clean and hot water shower, but they just have soap in the restroom. No shampoo.. Price was just 395 for single and 475 for double included all taxes. No hidden fee. I just spoke Spanish, so I'm not sure if they speak English or not.. Super cheap and safe.. Everything was fine. I'll stay again when I visit Mexico City!

Reviews.Title: “It's ok”
Reviews.Author: alwayslookingaround
Reviews.Content: Nice hot shower, no frills, clean hotel. Friendly staff. Easy walk to metro and metro bus. Bring your earplugs. The hotel is only as quiet as its guests. We stayed 5 nights, for 2 nights we were happy to have earplugs. There is no road traffic noise, which is great. Nice little pool.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but quite noisy...”
Reviews.Author: Coconuts_UK
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 4 nights. The location was good, near the Revolution Monument and walking distance to other sites of the city, plus shops, restaurants etc and not far at all from Chapultepec Park. However, it did get quite noisy at night. We saw on the hotel website that they have a connection with Six Flags to get discounted tickets. This wasn't the case. The man on reception sent us to one of their partner hotels and said they were waiting for us and could get us tickets, however when we arrived they didn't know what we were talking about, so was wasted money in a taxi. Overall, I would say our stay was ok, but will probably try somewhere else if we return to Mexico City.

Reviews.Title: “Internet does not work, noisy, problems with key”
Reviews.Author: Northernette
Reviews.Content: I reserved through a website online and prices at the front desk were significantly lower. Taxes are not revealed on prices showed online. The street where this hotel is located is quite dark at night, avoid walking alone. The internet is extra, quite expensive and it does not work at all. The second night I had problems with my key and had to go three times to the front desk to get the problem solved. Their solution was that everytime I was to use the room I needed a bell boy to open with the master key. The price is good but so is the price of other hotels in the area with better services. The hotel is noisy at night as kids run in the corridors unattended.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice of a hotel when you are on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Travelone75
Reviews.Content: The hotel is walking distance to the city centre, shopping, banks and churches,etc. My room was small but it was clean, housekeeping was done everyday . They have a restaurant on main floor which offers good mexican menus ,I pay 150-200 pesos /meal for lunch or dinner . Internet does not work all the time, cost me 50 pesos/24hrs to be connected but just around the street corner is an internet cafe and it cost me 1peso/hr. Bring your adaptor plugins, to get one will cost another 25 pesos in the hotel.It was mostly quiet at night with some occasional loud noises heard from the elevator . Staff were pleasant and helpful.Taxi from the hotel is expensive, they charge me 90 pesos for a route that is normally 40...oh well, they offer security during your travel.

Reviews.Title: “for Spanish speakers only”
Reviews.Author: Mal_the_Pal_10
Reviews.Content: Hotel's website is dishonest: no satellite TV or remote (6 basic Spanish channels with no sub titles), rooms not air conditioned (central air not working or turned on) , no gift shop, no children's pool. Tiny room. Luggage had to be stored in closet. No light in closet required luggage removal for retrieval of any item.With no air conditioning had to keep windows open. No screens... after 2nd night counted 17 mosquito bites on head, neck, arms. Very noisy...could hear everything that went on in nearby rooms. Shower had a hole in partition and flooded bathroom floor. Shower floor not sanitary, bathroom window very dirty. Elevator leveller system doesn't work properly missing its position by 2 to 8 inches leading to stubbed toes or stumbles. Wireless internet cost 50 pesos/24 hours and then of very short range (didn't work at bar next door) and not 100% reliable. All staff very rude and unhelpful with the exception of the 2 English speaking doormen. Was made fun of by desk staff. Food and beverage staff in overpriced restaurant unwilling to assist even when I was the only customer. No complementary ice to cool beverages in room. (ca be obtained at the liquor store across the street cheaply). Take the $5 you save on Wi-Fi and spend it on an upgrade to a nicer property that includes internet access. Only redeeming factors: pool (closes too early at 8:00 PM), decent location, price. STAY AWAY UNLESS FLUENT SPANISH SPEAKER ON A VERY TIGHT BUDGET.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Basics & Location”
Reviews.Author: bruinjay
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here in for just about a week each in August '04, May '08, and June '09. It was easy to book online or via the phone. Rates are very reasonable, the rooms small but comfortable, and the location excellent in terms of nearness to just about everything (Monument to the Revolution, Zocalo, Alameda Park, Insurgentes/Reforma, Zona Rosa, & Chapultepec -- all walkable as is the Revolucion Metro Station. The nearby streets are relatively quiet at night. While there are a couple of relatively good restaurants fairly close (along with a Starbucks), most of the rest are just so-so (including two Sanborns or avoidable (VIPs). Their own restaurant is just fair but with good service. I like the breakfasts. My only complaints are that sometimes the interior light well can be noisy from visiting school groups (who also crowd the elevators). I also find it a bit annoying to have to buy internet access (available throughout the hotel) every 24 hours for a relatively small fee. Their fees for doing any laundry work are just outrageous - so skip that. Otherwise, I will stay here again for the convenience and the price.

Reviews.Title: “Bueno Sin Grandes Pretensiones”
Reviews.Author: gasagoose
Reviews.Content: This is a great deal if you are a non pretencious person,and you are just lokking for a nice affordable place to stay. is very well located,kind of hide but one st walk from reforma av. and about 15 min walking to downtown,chapultepec and other nice areas clean,not fancy,minimum ammenities(just soap,and drinking water) witha nice pool onn the roof,a huge plus to relax. the staf is not bilibgul but they will try to assist you,but better practice your "espaÃ±ol" other wise not even try to communicate with them nice price,clean and plain,enough for a bussines trip or a comfort vacation hotel

Reviews.Title: “Corinto is a solid choice.”
Reviews.Author: JonMG
Reviews.Content: Recently spent a night at the Cortinto with my girlfriend. We found our lodging to be clean and comfortable. The rooms are small and basic, but a good value. The staff was friendly and helpful, and the hotel is in a good location. I would certainly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Bad Choice !”
Reviews.Author: SouthCarolinaAle
Reviews.Content: We made a big mistake by booking in this "HOTEL". Rooms are very COLD and smelly.It took us 3 nights of freezing temperatures to get an extra blanket. NO HEAT when the temperature dropped to -8 C at nite (cold wave during Thanksgiving in the DF.) The staff is not very friendly and worst of all during an emergency they DID NOT know how to make a phone call to the US. Never again. !

Reviews.Title: “What a deal!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Hotel Corinto in Mexico City and had a pleasant experience there. This nine story hotel is located between the Zona Rosa and the Alameda Central, about four blocks from the Hidalgo Metro Station and a 20 minute walk to Chapultapec Park. Its not as convenient to restaurants and nightlife as hotels in the Centro Historico might be, but its still a nice, quiet hotel. It has a small pool and garden on the roof and a restaurant / bar in the lobby. The room was very clean and quiet. I would recommend requesting a room with a window in case its warm like the night I was there. Its a bargain for $38 US.

HotelInfo.Name: Corinto Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Calle Ignacio L. Vallarta #24 Col. Tabacalera, Mexico City 06030, Mexico
